nivel1.pregunta: What is the <hr>tag typically used for?
nivel1.respuesta2: This tag is depreciated and should not be used.
nivel1.respuesta3: It designates a topic shift within a section at the paragraph level.
nivel1.respuesta4: It designates a shift of topic at the section level.
nivel1.correcta: It designates a topic shift within a section at the paragraph level.

nivel1.respuesta1: It programmatically associates a text label with an interface element.
nivel1.respuesta2: It overrides the name attribute's value on a child input element.
nivel1.respuesta3: It creates an ID for a corresponding input element.
nivel1.respuesta4: It labels webpages with important information.
nivel1.correcta: It programmatically associates a text label with an interface element.

nivel1.pregunta: What is the difference between the <div> and <span> tags?
nivel1.respuesta1: <div> is used where a generic block-level tag is needed, while <span> is used where a generic inline tag is needed.
nivel1.respuesta2: <div> is used for major divisions on a page, while <span> is used to span across columns.
nivel1.respuesta3: <div> is the industry-standard default tag, but you could use <span> if you prefer.
nivel1.respuesta4: <div> is used where a generic inline tag is needed, while <span> is used where a generic block-level tag is needed.
nivel1.correcta: <div> is used where a generic block-level tag is needed, while <span> is used where a generic inline tag is needed.

nivel1.pregunta: When should you use <ol> and <ul> elements?
nivel1.respuesta1: Use <ul> when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use <ol> when you have a list of items that could go in any order.
nivel1.respuesta2: Use <ul> when you want a bulleted list and <ol> when you want a numbered list.
nivel1.respuesta3: Use <ol> when you want a bulleted list and <ul> when you want a numbered list.
nivel1.respuesta4: Use <ol> when you have a list of items in which the order of the items matters. Use <ul> when you have a list of items that could go in any order.
nivel1.correcta: Use <ul> when you want a bulleted list and <ol> when you want a numbered list.

nivel3.pregunta: Which operator returns true if the two compared values are not equal?
How is a forEach statement different from a for statement?
nivel3.respuesta1: A for statement is generic, but a forEach statement can be used only with an array.
nivel3.respuesta2: Only a forEach statement lets you specify your own iterator.
nivel3.respuesta3: A forEach statement is generic, but a for statement can be used only with an array.
nivel3.respuesta4: Only a for statement uses a callback function.
nivel3.correcta: A for statement is generic, but a forEach statement can be used only with an array.
